description.narrative: The Fund is expected to have a significant development impact in promoting energy efficiency and renewable energy products to households and SMEs. This in turn will support climate change mitigation and its associated benefits such as increased energy efficiency, and reduction in pollution levels. The Fund is also expected to demonstrate that energy efficient projects can be bankable, thereby leading to increased investment in this area by the private sector. Coupled with this demonstration effect will be the transfer of knowledge that will be achieved in some markets by the Technical Assistance Facility with respect to appraising climate change products and ensuring they are bankable.

The proposed project envisages an IFC investment of up to US$75 million in the Global Climate Partnership Fund (the Fund) which has been set up as a Specialized Investment Fund (SICAV-SIF) under Luxemburg law in December 2009.
Promoted by KfW Entwicklungsbank (KfW), the Fund is a proposed up to US$500 million collective debt investment vehicle that will provide financing mainly for on-lending to small and medium-sized enterprises and households in sustainable energy projects through financial institutions (FIs) and, to a lesser extent, will make direct investments in renewable energy/energy efficiency projects globally.
